name: Lavender
description: Lavender is a flowering plant in the mint family, with a great aroma and will help you to relax.
flavour: Floral notes with an earthy undertone.

name: Lemon Balm
description: Lemon balm belongs to the mint family, it has a calm effect, used historically for relieve the nervous tension.
flavour: Pleasantly mild, with subtle citrus notes.

name: Schisandra
description: Schisandra berry hails from wild, lush, and mountainous regions throughout China, it has adaptogenic properties which helps the body resist anxiety and stress.
flavour: Fruity with a uniquely quenching balance of five flavours: sweet, sour, salty, bitter, pungent.

name: Peppermint
description: The active ingredient in peppermint is menthol, which is said to stimulate passion and creativity.

name: St. John's Wort
description: St John's Wort tea is drunk for its calming nature, its leaves, flowers, and seeds can be used to make the tea.

name: Valerian
description: Valerian is a root and a herbal sedative, its name come from the Latin word 'valere' which essentially means 'to be well'.

name: Rooibos
description: Rooibos is made from the leaves of the Aspalathus linearis plant and is rich in antioxidants.

name: Turmeric
description: Turmeric tea is made from the roots of the turmeric plant, and the main component in turmeric is curcumin.

name: Matcha
description: Stay focused, calm and energised with organic Matcha – the combo of caffeine and L-theanine buddy up to give you a slower, sustained release of energy without any jitters. Power on for longer with this super turbo energy tea!

name: Green Tea
description: Allow this traditional tea of Japan to lift your spirits day or night with a fresh, clean yet subtly powerful brew. This Japanese Sencha is grassy green and oh so vibrant. Green tea is used to improve mental alertness and thinking

name: Earl Grey
description: This quintessential English tea is filled with a variety of health benefits. Earl Grey tea is loaded with antioxidants and catechins that can help fight oral infections

name: White Tea
description: “White tea is rich in the amino acid l-theanine (almost as much as green tea), a compound that is associated with calm and improved focus.”

name: Holy Basil
description: A soothing cup of tea with strong notes of fresh basil. Tulsi, or holy basil, is quite popular for its medicinal properties in Eastern part of the world.

name: Chamomile
description: Drinking this fresh, Pennsylvania-grown Chamomile Herbal Tea is like snuggling up on your couch with a warm blanket for some quiet relaxation time. Full-bodied floral aroma with hints of apple.

name: Kanna
description: Kanna is an indigenous South African plant that's been used for centuries as an herbal remedy and natural category booster.

name: Rosemary
description: Rich in vitamins, minerals and antioxidants, rosemary has been used for centuries as food and medicine. It aids in digestion, improves mental focus and keeps your brain sharp.

name: Hop Tea
description: Hop tea is made by pouring hot water over fresh or dried hop cones and allowing them to steep. It's great for a bedtime tea because of its sedative properties

name: Passion Flower Tea
description: Passionflower is a flowering type of vine that's been said to help with insomnia, anxiety, hot flashes, pain, and more. With over 500 known species of the plant, there's a lot of benefits to go around.
origin: The United States, Central and South America

name: Masala Tea
description: Full-bodied black tea, made by boiling it in milk with a mixture of aromatic traditional Indian herbs and spices.
ingredients: 'Black Tea, Cinnamon, Cardamom, Ginger Root, Black Pepper, Cloves

name: Ginseg Tea
description: Ginseng has been used in Chinese medicine for hundreds of years to improve health. It has a strong, distinctly bitter flavour with earthy, warming notes.

name: Ashwaganda Tea
description: Traditionally used in African and Indian herbal medicine, this tea is believed to help the body cope with stress and improve brain function. It has an earthy, somewhat pungent, slightly creamy taste.

name: Oonlog Tea
description: Floral and fruity at the same time, with a strong orange flavour, the Oolong tea is refreshing an tasty. It can also provide benefits to health including combating heart disease and diabetes.

name: Yerba Tea
description: Rich in antioxidants and nutrients, it can be made pure or with varied blends of flowers and fruits. The Yerba mate may be served cold or hot. its leaves and twigs are dried, typically over a fire, and steeped in hot water to make an herbal tea.
